page.title: 04Housing
page.content: The distribution of houses within our block is confined to one grid square in the south east. These houses, comprise mainly of the {terraced}variety, are the nucleus of the old town, some dwellings being built prior to 1850. There is considerable residue of unimproved housing, often in{poor repair. Within the last decade, two hundred and one{new houses}have been built in the Senhouse Street area and a further fourteen are being built in North Watt Street. Allerdale District Council report, that there is sufficient housing land for further development but the release of this land may be expensive because of{sewage problems particularly at Oldside, north of the River Derwent.
